programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Heat and the 76ers, at similar places in the East standings, square off in Philadelphia. Miami took the first two clashes this campaign by a combined 11 points. Bam Adebayo (MIA) averaged 24.5 points and 14 rebounds in the two victories.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Knicks continue a four-game road trip by squaring off with the Warriors in the Bay Area. Golden State aims for the season-series sweep after taking a 110-99 victory over New York on Feb. 29. Stephen Curry (GS) posted 31 points and 11 rebounds.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.desc: The Knicks continue a four-game road trip by squaring off with the Warriors in the Bay Area. Golden State aims for the season-series sweep after taking a 110-99 victory over New York on Feb. 29. Stephen Curry (GS) posted 31 points and 11 rebounds.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: 2024 NIT Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: From Stegeman Coliseum in Athens, Ga.

programme.title: 2024 NIT Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: The No. 3 Hawkeyes (18-14) host the Wildcats (19-14) in an NIT first-round matchup. Kansas State reached the Big 12's quarterfinals while Iowa was bumped from the Big Ten's second round. The schools have split eight meetings with the last in 2008.

programme.title: NBA Countdown
programme.desc: "NBA Countdown" serves as the primer for game telecasts on the ESPN family of networks. It's highlighted by a lively roundtable discussion and debate of the top storylines around the league. Seats at the table are reserved for folks in ESPN's stable of NBA hosts and analysts, with the latter group imparting wisdom based on their many years of playing experience.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Boston hosts Milwaukee. On this day in 1985, Larry Bird triple-doubled while Hall-of-Fame teammates Robert Parish and Kevin McHale double-doubled in a 107-105 Celtics victory. Bucks HOFer Sidney Moncrief had a dismal shooting night, going 1-for-10.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Golden State hosts Memphis. On Feb. 2, the Warriors topped the Grizzlies for the first time in four tries, with all outings being played in Grind City in that stretch. Standout Dubs rookie Brandin Podziemski handed out 14 assists in the February win.

programme.title: 2024 NIT Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: From Value City Arena in Columbus, Ohio.

programme.title: 2024 NIT Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: The Spiders face an Old Dominion rival in the No. 3 Hokies during this first-round NIT showing. The in-state foes have not shared the floor since 2009, when Virginia Tech prevailed 62-48. Richmond senior Jordan King averages 18.4 points per game.

programme.title: 2024 NIT Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: The Anteaters (24-9) run up against the second-seeded Utes (19-14) in the first round of the NIT. UC Irvine came up just short against upstart Long Beach State in the Big West Tournament championship game. Utah made it to the NIT final in 2018.

programme.title: Good Guy/Bad Guy
programme.desc: The ex-champion of the two divisions of the UFC Daniel Cormier and former MMA fighter Chael Sonnen talk about their passion shared by MMA and the rest of the sport world.

programme.title: 2024 NIT Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: The No. 1 Pirates (20-12) host the Hawks (21-13) for an NIT first-round game. Seton Hall surprised some when its NCAA Tournament bubble burst. Erik Reynolds II, an Atlantic 10 first-team selection, leads Saint Joseph's at 17 points per game.

programme.title: 2024 NIT Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: Eric Dixon and the No. 1 Wildcats (18-15) host the Rams (22-13) at Finneran Pavilion for an NIT first-round affair. VCU fell to Duquesne 57-51 in the Atlantic 10 title game. Dixon, a senior forward, goes for 16.5 points and 6.3 rebounds per contest.

programme.title: 2024 NIT Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: The 2024 NIT begins with defending champion North Texas clashing with No. 4 LSU in the first round. The Tigers topped the Mean Green in a Charleston Classic consolation contest 66-62 on Nov. 17, 2023. Texas native Will Baker (LSU) scored 16 points.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Unsportsmanlike with Evan, Canty and Michelle
programme.desc: Start the day off right with Chris Canty, Evan Cohen and Michelle Smallmon providing an energizing and informative way to take on the day. Sports, life and laughter are what it's all about.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: The Jay Bilas 'My Bracket is Better Than Your Bracket' Special
programme.desc: College basketball analyst Jay Bilas shares inside information on picking brackets.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: ESPN Sports Betting Analysts Erin Dolan and Joe Fortenbaugh, along with host Tyler Fulghum, break down the biggest storylines through the lens of sports betting, with breakdowns, discussions and picks.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: The Mina Kimes Show Featuring Lenny
programme.desc: Mina Kimes combines intense film study with sharp data analysis, plus her trademark humor and insight. She's joined each episode by a guest from around the league.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: The Point
programme.desc: ESPN's flagship hockey show featuring highlights, news, analysis, speed, skill and access to the biggest stars, stories and personalities of the game. Hosted by John Buccigross.

programme.title: 2024 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: Arizona goes up against Auburn in this First Four match that determines a No. 11 seed for the NCAA Tournament. The Wildcats, the 2021 national runner-up, make a fourth straight tourney appearance. The winner draws No. 6 Syracuse in the round of 64.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: The Food City 500 returns to Bristol Motor Speedway as the NASCAR Cup Series schedule resumes. Christopher Bell triumphed at this event last season in its last of three years on a dirt track. Brad Keselowski was the last winner on concrete in 2020.

programme.desc: All the action from rodeo competitions.

programme.title: Jackie Robinson: Get to the Bag
programme.desc: Spotlights the remarkable career of Jackie Robinson beyond baseball by blending the narrative of rapper Skyzoo and the voices of multiple generations to celebrate Robinson's extraordinary life and legacy, shedding new light on his journey.
